name: English trans-dev
tagline: Machine-corrected English translations of Greek and Latin works.
body:
#Welcome to english_trans-dev!

##About
This repository contains machine-corrected English translations of public-domain Greek and Latin works.

These XML files were produced by data entry company [Jouve](http://jouve.com/en), who OCR'd, corrected and encoded the texts in accordance with the latest [EpiDoc](http://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/wiki/Home/) standards. While adequate, more can and should be done to improve the XML (the -dev(elopment) suffix indicates the repository is open to improvement).

##Contents

###Ancient Greek
* Aeschylus. _[The Plays of Aeschylus](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aeschylus_1909)_, Translated by Walter Headlam & Clinton Edward Sowerby Headlam (1909) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aeschylus. _[Tragedies](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aeschylus_1888)_, Translated by Theodore Alois Buckley (1888) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aeschylus. _[Dramas](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aeschylus_1886)_, Translated by Anna Swanwick (1886) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Alciphron. _[The Letters of Alciphron] (https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/alciphron_1896)_, Privately printed for the Athenian Society (1896) Athens. 
* Apollonius Rhodius. _[Argonautica](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/apollonius_1889)_, Translated by Edward P. Coleridge (1889) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[Frogs](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1919)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1919) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[Clouds](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1852)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1852) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[Wasps](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1875)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1875) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[Peace](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1913)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1913) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[Ecclesiazusae](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1902)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[The Comedies of Aristophanes, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1907_1)_, Translated by William James Hickie (1907) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[The Comedies of Aristophanes, vol. 6](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_1907_2)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1907) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristophanes. _[The Comedies of Aristophanes, vol. 4](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristophanes_4_1911)_, Translated by Benjamin Bickley Rogers (1911) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[The Nicomachean Ethics](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_1895)_, Translated by Robert William Browne (1895) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[The History of Animals](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/aristotle_1878.xml)_, Translated by Richard Cresswell (1878) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[Organon, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_1_1908)_, Translated by Octavius Freire Owen (1908) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[Organon, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_organon_1853_ddb1)_, Translated by Octavius Freire Owen (1853) London: Henry G. Bohn.
* Aristotle. _[Organon, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_2_1902)_, Translated by Octavius Freire Owen (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[Politics and Economics](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_1881)_, Translated by Edward Walford (1881) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[Metaphysics](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_1896)_, Translated by Rev. John H. M'Mahon (1896) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Aristotle. _[Rhetoric and Poetics](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/aristotle_1906)_, Translated by Theodore Buckley (1906) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Chariton of Aphrodisios. _[The Loves of Chaereas and Callirrhoe](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/chariton_1764)_, (1764) London: T. Becket and P. A. De Hondt.
* Demosthenes. _[The Orations](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/demosthenes_1865)_, Translated by Charles Rann Kennedy (1865) London & New York: Bell & Daldy.
* Demosthenes. _[The Orations](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/demosthenes_1877)_, Translated by Charles Rann Kennedy (1877) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Demosthenes. _[The Orations](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/demosthenes_1902)_, Translated by Charles Rann Kennedy (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Diogenes Laertius. _[The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosphers](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/diogenesLaertius_1853)_, Translated by Charles Duke Yonge (1853) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Epictetus. _[Discourses, with the Encheiridion and Fragments](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/epictetus_1887)_, Translated by George Long (1887) London: George Bell and Sons.
* _[Greek Anthology](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/greekAnthology_1893)_, Translated by George Burges (1893) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Heliodorus, Longus and Achilles Tatius. _[Greek Romances](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/heliodorus_longus_achillesTatius_1901)_, Translated by Rowland Smith (1901) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Herodotus. _[Histories](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/herodotus_1879)_, Translated by Henry Cary (1879) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Herodotus. _[Histories](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/herodotus_1901)_, Translated by Henry Cary (1901) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Hesiod, Callimachus and Theognis. _[Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/hesiod-callim-theogn_1897)_, Translated by Rev. J. Banks (1897) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Homer. _[Odyssey, Hymns, Epigrams, The Battle of the Frogs and Mice, The Life of Homer](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/homer_1902)_, Translated by Theodore Alois Buckley and Kenneth R. H. Mackenzie (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Homer. _[Iliad](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/homer_1909)_, Translated by Alexander Pope (1909) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Julian the Emperor. _[Theosophical Works, with Gregory Nazianzen's Invectives and Libanius' Monody](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/julian_1888)_, Translated by C. W. King (1888) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Lucian. _[Dialogues](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/lucian_1888)_, Translated by Howard Williams (1888) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Pausanias. _[Description of Greece, Vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/pausanias_1886_1.xml)_, Translated by Arthur Richard Shilleto (1886) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Pausanias. _[Description of Greece, Vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/pausanias_2_1886)_, Translated by Arthur Richard Shilleto (1886) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Philo Alexandrinus. _[The Works, Vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/philo_1_1854)_, Translated by Charles Duke Yonge (1854) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Philo Alexandrinus. _[The Works, Vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/philo_2_1854.xml)_, Translated by Charles Duke Yonge (1854) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Pindar. _[Odes](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/pindar_1915)_, Translated by Dawson W. Turner and Abraham Moore (1915) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plato. _[Gorgias](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plato_1864)_, Translated by Edward Meredith Cope (1864) London: Bell and Dandy.
* Plotinus. _[Select Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plotinus_1895)_, Translated by Thomas Taylor (1895) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Ethical Essays](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plutarch_1898_ethical)_, Translated by Arthur Richard Shilleto (1898) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Theosophical Essays](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plutarch_1898_theosophical)_, Translated by Charles William King (1898) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Lives, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/plutarch_1_1906.xml)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart and George Long (1906) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Lives, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plutarch_2_1908)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart and George Long (1908) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Lives, vol. 3](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/plutarch_3_1908.xml)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart and George Long (1908) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plutarch. _[Lives, vol. 4](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plutarch_4_1908)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart and George Long (1908) London: George Bell and Sons.
* _[Greek Dramas by Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides and Aristophanes](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/greekDramas_1912.xml)_ (1912) London and New York: D. Appleton and Company.
* Sophocles. _[Tragedies](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/sophocles_1905)_, Translated by Edward P. Coleridge (1905) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Theocritus, Bion and Moschus. _[Idylls](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/theocritus_1878)_, Translated by Rev. J Banks and J. M. Chapman (1878) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Thucydides. _[History of the Peloponnesian War, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/thucydides_2_1902)_, Translated by Rev. Henry Dale (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Xenophon. _[Minor Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/xenophon_1898)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1898) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Xenophon. _[Minor Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/xenophonminor_1914)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1914) London: George Bell and Sons.

###Latin
* Alfred the Great. _[Translation of the History of Orosius](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/alfredGreat_orosius_1873)_, Translated by Benjamin Thorpe (1873) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Ammianus Marcellinus. _[The Roman History](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/ammianusMarcellinus_1894)_, Translated by Charles Duke Yonge (1894) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Boethius. _[De Consolatione Philosophiae](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/boethius_1895)_, Translated by Samuel Fox (1895) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Catullus & Tibullus. _[Poems](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/catullus_tibullus_1910)_, Translated by Walter K. Kelly (1910) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Cicero. _[On Oratory and Orators](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/cicero_1896)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1896) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Cicero. _[Three Books of Offices, and other Moral Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/cicero_1874)_, Translated by Cyrus R. Edmonds (1874) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Cicero & Pliny the Younger. _[Letters](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/cicero_plinyYounger_1909.xml)_ [Vol. 9], Translated by Evelyn Shirley Shuckburg (1909) New York: P.F. Collier and Son.
* Giraldus Cambrensis. _[Historical Works](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/giraldusCambrensis_1905)_, Translated by Thomas Forester and Sir Richard Colt Hoare (1905) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Horace. _[The Odes and Carmen Saeculare](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/horace_1865.xml)_, Translated by John Conington (1865) London: Bell and Dandy.
* Horace. _[Poems](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/horace_1902.xml)_, Translated by A. Hamilton Bryce (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* _[Justin, Cornepius Nepos and Eutropius](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/justin_cNepos_eutropius_1902)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1902) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Lucretius. _[Translations from Lucretius](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/lucretius_1920.xml)_, Translated by Robert Calverley Trevelyan (1920) London: George Allen & Unwin.
* Lucretius. _[De Rerum Natura](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/lucretius_1900.xml)_, Translated by Hugh Andrew Johnstone Munro (1900) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Lucretius. _[On The Nature of Things](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/lucretius_1893)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1893) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Martial. _[The Epigrams](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/martial_1871.xml)_ (1871) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Martial. _[The Epigrams](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/martial_1904)_ (1904) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Ovid. _[Fasti, Tristia, Pontic Epistles, Ibis, Halieuticon](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/ovid_1881)_, Translated by Henry Thomas Riley (1881) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plautus. _[Comedies, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/plautus_1_1880.xml)_, Translated by Henry Thomas Riley (1880) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Plautus. _[Comedies, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/plautus_2_1913)_, Translated by Henry Thomas Riley (1913) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Propertius. _[Elegies](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/propertius_1895)_, Translated by Rev. P. J. F. Gantillon (1895) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Seneca. _[On Benefits](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/seneca_1900.xml)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart (1900) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Seneca. _[Minor Dialogues](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/seneca_1889.xml)_, Translated by Aubrey Stewart (1889) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Terence, Phaedrus. _[Comedies, Fables](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/blob/master/terence_phaedrus_1891.xml)_, Translated by Henry Thomas Riley and Christopher Smart (1891) London: George Bell and Sons.
* Quintilian. _[Institutes of Oratory, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/quintilian_1_1910)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1910) London: George Bell and Sons. 
* Quintilian. _[Institutes of Oratory, vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/english_trans-dev/tree/master/quintilian_2_1913)_, Translated by Rev. John Selby Watson (1913) London: George Bell and Sons.
